titleStmt.title: A sermon preached at the funeral of the right honble the Lady Frances Paget, the religious consort of the right honble William Lord Paget, (eldest daughter to the right honourable Henry Earl of Holland, who was beheaded for his loyalty to this King) in the parish-church of West-Drayton in the county of Middlesex, on the 12th of Nevember, 1672. By Jehu Jenny, M.A. and Vicar of Harmondsworth.
titleStmt.author: Jenney, John, d. 1697.

titleStmt.title: A sermon preached at the funeral of the right honble the Lady Frances Paget, the religious consort of the right honble William Lord Paget, (eldest daughter to the right honourable Henry Earl of Holland, who was beheaded for his loyalty to this King) in the parish-church of West-Drayton in the county of Middlesex, on the 12th of Nevember, 1672. By Jehu Jenny, M.A. and Vicar of Harmondsworth.
titleStmt.author: Jenney, John, d. 1697.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by J.D. for Nevil Simmons at the Princes Arms in St. Paul's Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
